Config.name: get

Config.name: getSchema

Config.name: observe

Add a listener for changes to a given key path. This is different

current value of the config entry.

Config.name: onDidChange
Config.description:
Add a listener for changes to a given key path. If `keyPath` is

Directory.name: constructor
Directory.description: Configures a new Directory instance, no files are accessed.

Directory.name: contains
Directory.description:
Determines if the given path (real or symbolic) is inside this
directory. This method does not actually check if the path exists, it just
checks if the path is under this directory.

Directory.name: create
Directory.description:
Creates the directory on disk that corresponds to `::getPath()` if
no such directory already exists.

Directory.name: getEntries
Directory.description: Reads file entries in this directory from disk asynchronously.

Directory.name: getEntriesSync
Directory.description: Reads file entries in this directory from disk synchronously.

Directory.name: getFile
Directory.description:
Traverse within this Directory to a child File. This method doesn't
actually check to see if the File exists, it just creates the File object.

Directory.name: getSubdirectory
Directory.description:
Traverse within this a Directory to a child Directory. This method
doesn't actually check to see if the Directory exists, it just creates the
Directory object.

Directory.name: isRoot
Directory.description:
Return a {Boolean}, true if this {Directory} is the root directory
of the filesystem, or false if it isn't.

Directory.name: onDidChange
Directory.description: Invoke the given callback when the directory's contents change.

DisplayMarker.name: clearTail
DisplayMarker.description:
Removes the marker's tail. After calling the marker's head position
will be reported as its current tail position until the tail is planted
again.

DisplayMarker.name: compare
DisplayMarker.description: Compares this marker to another based on their ranges.

DisplayMarker.name: copy
DisplayMarker.description:
Creates and returns a new {DisplayMarker} with the same properties as
this marker.

DisplayMarker.name: destroy
DisplayMarker.description:
Destroys the marker, causing it to emit the 'destroyed' event. Once
destroyed, a marker cannot be restored by undo/redo operations.

DisplayMarker.name: getBufferRange
DisplayMarker.description: Gets the buffer range of this marker.

DisplayMarker.name: getEndBufferPosition
DisplayMarker.description:
Retrieves the buffer position of the marker's end. This will always be
greater than or equal to the result of {DisplayMarker::getStartBufferPosition}.

DisplayMarker.name: getEndScreenPosition
DisplayMarker.description:
Retrieves the screen position of the marker's end. This will always be
greater than or equal to the result of {DisplayMarker::getStartScreenPosition}.

DisplayMarker.name: getHeadBufferPosition
DisplayMarker.description: Retrieves the buffer position of the marker's head.

DisplayMarker.name: getHeadScreenPosition
DisplayMarker.description: Retrieves the screen position of the marker's head.

DisplayMarker.name: getInvalidationStrategy
DisplayMarker.description: Get the invalidation strategy for this marker.

DisplayMarker.name: getScreenRange
DisplayMarker.description: Gets the screen range of this marker.

DisplayMarker.name: getStartBufferPosition
DisplayMarker.description:
Retrieves the buffer position of the marker's start. This will always be
less than or equal to the result of {DisplayMarker::getEndBufferPosition}.

DisplayMarker.name: getStartScreenPosition
DisplayMarker.description:
Retrieves the screen position of the marker's start. This will always be
less than or equal to the result of {DisplayMarker::getEndScreenPosition}.

DisplayMarker.name: getTailBufferPosition
DisplayMarker.description: Retrieves the buffer position of the marker's tail.

DisplayMarker.name: getTailScreenPosition
DisplayMarker.description: Retrieves the screen position of the marker's tail.

DisplayMarker.name: onDidChange
DisplayMarker.description: Invoke the given callback when the state of the marker changes.

DisplayMarker.name: onDidDestroy
DisplayMarker.description: Invoke the given callback when the marker is destroyed.

DisplayMarker.name: plantTail
DisplayMarker.description:
Plants the marker's tail at the current head position. After calling
the marker's tail position will be its head position at the time of the
call, regardless of where the marker's head is moved.

DisplayMarker.name: setBufferRange
DisplayMarker.description: Modifies the buffer range of this marker.

DisplayMarker.name: setHeadBufferPosition
DisplayMarker.description: Sets the buffer position of the marker's head.

DisplayMarker.name: setHeadScreenPosition
DisplayMarker.description: Sets the screen position of the marker's head.

DisplayMarker.name: setProperties
DisplayMarker.description:

DisplayMarker.name: setScreenRange

DisplayMarker.name: setTailBufferPosition

DisplayMarker.name: setTailScreenPosition

DisplayMarkerLayer.name: onDidCreateMarker
DisplayMarkerLayer.description:
Subscribe to be notified synchronously whenever markers are created
on this layer. *Avoid this method for optimal performance when interacting
with layers that could contain large numbers of markers.*

DisplayMarkerLayer.name: onDidDestroy
DisplayMarkerLayer.description: Subscribe to be notified synchronously when this layer is destroyed.

DisplayMarkerLayer.name: onDidUpdate
DisplayMarkerLayer.description:
Subscribe to be notified asynchronously whenever markers are
created, updated, or destroyed on this layer. *Prefer this method for

Disposable.name: dispose

Dock.name: activate

Dock.description: Make the next pane active.

Dock.description: Make the previous pane active.

Dock.description: Get all pane items in the dock.

Dock.description: Get all panes in the dock.

Hide the dock and activate the {WorkspaceCenter} if the dock was
was previously focused.

Dock.name: isVisible
Dock.description: Check if the dock is visible.

Dock.name: observeActivePane
Dock.description:
Invoke the given callback with the current active pane and when
the active pane changes.

Dock.name: observeActivePaneItem
Dock.description:
Invoke the given callback with the current active pane item and
with all future active pane items in the dock.

Dock.name: observePaneItems
Dock.description:
Invoke the given callback with all current and future panes items
in the dock.

Dock.name: observePanes
Dock.description:
Invoke the given callback with all current and future panes in the
dock.

Dock.name: observeVisible
Dock.description: Invoke the given callback with the current and all future visibilities of the dock.

Dock.name: onDidAddPane

Dock.name: onDidAddPaneItem

Dock.name: onDidChangeActivePane
Dock.description: Invoke the given callback when the active pane changes.

Dock.name: onDidChangeActivePaneItem

Dock.name: onDidChangeVisible
Dock.description: Invoke the given callback when the visibility of the dock changes.

Dock.name: onDidDestroyPane
Dock.description: Invoke the given callback when a pane is destroyed in the dock.

Dock.name: onDidDestroyPaneItem
Dock.description: Invoke the given callback when a pane item is destroyed.

Dock.name: onDidStopChangingActivePaneItem

Invoke the given callback when the active pane item stops

Dock.name: onWillDestroyPane
Dock.description:
Invoke the given callback before a pane is destroyed in the
dock.

Dock.name: onWillDestroyPaneItem
Dock.description:
Invoke the given callback when a pane item is about to be
destroyed, before the user is prompted to save it.

Dock.name: show
Dock.description: Show the dock without focusing it.

Dock.name: toggle
Dock.description:
Toggle the dock's visibility without changing the {Workspace}'s
active pane container.

Emitter.name: emit
Emitter.description: Invoke handlers registered via {::on} for the given event name.

Emitter.name: on
Emitter.description:
Register the given handler function to be invoked whenever events by
the given name are emitted via {::emit}.

Emitter.name: once
Emitter.description:
Register the given handler function to be invoked the next time an
events with the given name is emitted via {::emit}.

Emitter.name: preempt
Emitter.description:
Register the given handler function to be invoked *before* all
other handlers existing at the time of subscription whenever events by the
given name are emitted via {::emit}.

KeymapManager.name: addKeystrokeResolver

Customize translation of raw keyboard events to keystroke strings.
This API is useful for working around Chrome bugs or changing how Atom
resolves certain key combinations. If multiple resolvers are installed,
the most recently-added resolver returning a string for a given keystroke
takes precedence.

KeymapManager.name: getPartialMatchTimeout
KeymapManager.description:
Get the number of milliseconds allowed before pending states caused

KeymapManager.name: handleKeyboardEvent
KeymapManager.description:
Dispatch a custom event associated with the matching key binding for
the given `KeyboardEvent` if one can be found.

KeymapManager.name: keystrokeForKeyboardEvent

KeymapManager.name: onDidFailToReadFile
KeymapManager.description: Invoke the given callback when a keymap file not able to be loaded.

KeymapManager.description:
Invoke the given callback when one or more keystrokes completely

KeymapManager.name: onDidPartiallyMatchBindings
KeymapManager.description:
Invoke the given callback when one or more keystrokes partially
match a binding.

KeymapManager.name: watchKeymap
KeymapManager.description:
Cause the keymap to reload the key bindings file at the given path
whenever it changes.

optimal performance when interacting with layers that could contain large
numbers of markers.*

PathWatcher.name: dispose
PathWatcher.description:
Unsubscribe all subscribers from filesystem events. Native resources will be release asynchronously,
but this watcher will stop broadcasting events immediately.

PathWatcher.name: getStartPromise
PathWatcher.description:
Return a {Promise} that will resolve when the underlying native watcher is ready to begin sending events.
When testing filesystem watchers, it's important to await this promise before making filesystem changes that you
intend to assert about because there will be a delay between the instantiation of the watcher and the activation
of the underlying OS resources that feed it events.

PathWatcher.name: onDidError
PathWatcher.description: Invoke a {Function} when any errors related to this watcher are reported.

Selection.name: addSelectionAbove
Selection.description: Moves the selection up one row.

Selection.name: addSelectionBelow
Selection.description: Moves the selection down one row.

Selection.name: autoIndentSelectedRows
Selection.description:
Sets the indentation level of all selected rows to values suggested
by the relevant grammars.

Selection.name: backspace
Selection.description:
Removes the first character before the selection if the selection
is empty otherwise it deletes the selection.

Selection.name: clear
Selection.description: Clears the selection, moving the marker to the head.

Selection.name: compare
Selection.description:
Compare this selection's buffer range to another selection's buffer
range.

Selection.description: Copies the current selection to the clipboard.

Selection.name: cut
Selection.description: Copies the selection to the clipboard and then deletes it.

Selection.name: cutToEndOfBufferLine
Selection.description: Cuts the selection until the end of the buffer line.

Selection.name: cutToEndOfLine
Selection.description: Cuts the selection until the end of the screen line.

Selection.name: delete
Selection.description:
Removes the selection or the next character after the start of the
selection if the selection is empty.

Selection.name: deleteLine
Selection.description:
Removes the line at the beginning of the selection if the selection
is empty unless the selection spans multiple lines in which case all lines
are removed.

Selection.name: deleteSelectedText
Selection.description: Removes only the selected text.

Selection.name: deleteToBeginningOfLine
Selection.description:
Removes from the beginning of the line which the selection begins on
all the way through to the end of the selection.

Selection.name: deleteToBeginningOfSubword
Selection.description:
Removes the selection or all characters from the start of the
selection to the end of the current word if nothing is selected.

Selection.name: deleteToBeginningOfWord
Selection.description:
Removes from the start of the selection to the beginning of the
current word if the selection is empty otherwise it deletes the selection.

Selection.name: deleteToEndOfLine
Selection.description:
If the selection is empty, removes all text from the cursor to the
end of the line. If the cursor is already at the end of the line, it
removes the following newline. If the selection isn't empty, only deletes
the contents of the selection.

Selection.name: deleteToEndOfSubword
Selection.description:
Removes the selection or all characters from the start of the
selection to the end of the current word if nothing is selected.

Selection.name: deleteToEndOfWord
Selection.description:
Removes the selection or all characters from the start of the
selection to the end of the current word if nothing is selected.

Selection.name: deleteToNextWordBoundary
Selection.description:
Removes the selection or, if nothing is selected, then all
characters from the start of the selection up to the next word
boundary.

Selection.name: deleteToPreviousWordBoundary
Selection.description:
Removes the selection or, if nothing is selected, then all
characters from the start of the selection back to the previous word
boundary.

Selection.name: expandOverLine
Selection.description:
Expands the newest selection to include the entire line on which

Selection.name: expandOverWord

Scan regular expression matches in a given range , calling the given
iterator function on each match.

TextBuffer.name: setEncoding
TextBuffer.description: Sets the character set encoding for this buffer.

TextBuffer.name: setPath
TextBuffer.description: Set the path for the buffer's associated file.

TextBuffer.name: setText
TextBuffer.description: Replace the entire contents of the buffer with the given text.

TextBuffer.name: setTextInRange
TextBuffer.description: Set the text in the given range.

TextBuffer.name: setTextViaDiff
TextBuffer.description:
Replace the current buffer contents by applying a diff based on the
given text.

TextBuffer.name: transact
TextBuffer.description: Batch multiple operations as a single undo/redo step.

TextBuffer.name: undo
TextBuffer.description: Undo the last operation. If a transaction is in progress, aborts it.

TextEditor.name: abortTransaction
TextEditor.description:
Abort an open transaction, undoing any operations performed so far
within the transaction.

TextEditor.name: addCursorAtBufferPosition
TextEditor.description: Add a cursor at the given position in buffer coordinates.

TextEditor.name: addCursorAtScreenPosition
TextEditor.description: Add a cursor at the position in screen coordinates.

TextEditor.name: addGutter
TextEditor.description: Add a custom {Gutter}.

TextEditor.name: addMarkerLayer
TextEditor.description: Create a marker layer to group related markers.

TextEditor.name: addSelectionForBufferRange
TextEditor.description: Add a selection for the given range in buffer coordinates.

TextEditor.name: addSelectionForScreenRange
TextEditor.description: Add a selection for the given range in screen coordinates.

TextEditor.name: autoIndentSelectedRows
TextEditor.description:
Indent rows intersecting selections based on the grammar's suggested
indent level.

TextEditor.name: backspace
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, if the selection is empty, delete the character
preceding the cursor. Otherwise delete the selected text.

TextEditor.name: backwardsScanInBufferRange
TextEditor.description:
Scan regular expression matches in a given range in reverse order,
calling the given iterator function on each match.

TextEditor.name: bufferPositionForScreenPosition
TextEditor.description: Convert a position in screen-coordinates to buffer-coordinates.

TextEditor.name: bufferRangeForScopeAtCursor
TextEditor.description:
Get the range in buffer coordinates of all tokens surrounding the
cursor that match the given scope selector.

TextEditor.name: bufferRangeForScreenRange
TextEditor.description: Convert a range in screen-coordinates to buffer-coordinates.

TextEditor.name: clipBufferPosition
TextEditor.description: Clip the given {Point} to a valid position in the buffer.

TextEditor.name: clipBufferRange
TextEditor.description:
Clip the start and end of the given range to valid positions in the
buffer. See {::clipBufferPosition} for more information.

TextEditor.name: clipScreenPosition
TextEditor.description: Clip the given {Point} to a valid position on screen.

TextEditor.name: clipScreenRange
TextEditor.description:
Clip the start and end of the given range to valid positions on screen.
See {::clipScreenPosition} for more information.

TextEditor.name: copySelectedText
TextEditor.description: For each selection, copy the selected text.

TextEditor.name: createCheckpoint
TextEditor.description:
Create a pointer to the current state of the buffer for use
with {::revertToCheckpoint} and {::groupChangesSinceCheckpoint}.

TextEditor.name: cutSelectedText
TextEditor.description: For each selection, cut the selected text.

TextEditor.name: cutToEndOfBufferLine
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, if the selection is empty, cut all characters
of the containing buffer line following the cursor. Otherwise cut the
selected text.

TextEditor.name: cutToEndOfLine
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, if the selection is empty, cut all characters
of the containing screen line following the cursor. Otherwise cut the selected
text.

TextEditor.name: decorateMarker
TextEditor.description:
Add a decoration that tracks a {DisplayMarker}. When the
marker moves, is invalidated, or is destroyed, the decoration will be
updated to reflect the marker's state.

TextEditor.name: decorateMarkerLayer
TextEditor.description:
Add a decoration to every marker in the given marker layer. Can
be used to decorate a large number of markers without having to create and
manage many individual decorations.

TextEditor.name: delete
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, if the selection is empty, delete the character
following the cursor. Otherwise delete the selected text.

TextEditor.name: deleteLine
TextEditor.description: Delete all lines intersecting selections.

TextEditor.name: deleteToBeginningOfLine
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, if the selection is empty, delete all characters
of the containing line that precede the cursor. Otherwise delete the
selected text.

TextEditor.name: deleteToBeginningOfSubword
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, if the selection is empty, delete all characters
of the containing subword following the cursor. Otherwise delete the selected
text.

TextEditor.name: deleteToBeginningOfWord
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, if the selection is empty, delete all characters
of the containing word that precede the cursor. Otherwise delete the
selected text.

TextEditor.name: deleteToEndOfLine
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, if the selection is not empty, deletes the
selection; otherwise, deletes all characters of the containing line
following the cursor. If the cursor is already at the end of the line,
deletes the following newline.

TextEditor.name: deleteToEndOfSubword
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, if the selection is empty, delete all characters
of the containing subword following the cursor. Otherwise delete the selected
text.

TextEditor.name: deleteToEndOfWord
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, if the selection is empty, delete all characters
of the containing word following the cursor. Otherwise delete the selected
text.

TextEditor.name: deleteToNextWordBoundary
TextEditor.description:
Similar to {::deleteToEndOfWord}, but deletes only up to the
next word boundary.

TextEditor.name: deleteToPreviousWordBoundary
TextEditor.description:
Similar to {::deleteToBeginningOfWord}, but deletes only back to the
previous word boundary.

TextEditor.name: findMarkers
TextEditor.description:
Find all {DisplayMarker}s on the default marker layer that
match the given properties.

TextEditor.name: foldAll
TextEditor.description: Fold all foldable lines.

TextEditor.name: foldAllAtIndentLevel
TextEditor.description: Fold all foldable lines at the given indent level.

TextEditor.name: foldBufferRow
TextEditor.description:
Fold the given row in buffer coordinates based on its indentation
level.

TextEditor.name: foldCurrentRow
TextEditor.description: Fold the most recent cursor's row based on its indentation level.

TextEditor.name: foldSelectedLines
TextEditor.description: For each selection, fold the rows it intersects.

TextEditor.name: getBuffer
TextEditor.description: Retrieves the current {TextBuffer}.

TextEditor.name: getCurrentParagraphBufferRange
TextEditor.description:
Get the {Range} of the paragraph surrounding the most recently added
cursor.

TextEditor.name: getCursorAtScreenPosition
TextEditor.description: Get a {Cursor} at given screen coordinates {Point}

TextEditor.name: getCursorBufferPosition
TextEditor.description:
Get the position of the most recently added cursor in buffer
coordinates.

TextEditor.name: getCursorBufferPositions
TextEditor.description: Get the position of all the cursor positions in buffer coordinates.

TextEditor.name: getCursorScreenPosition
TextEditor.description:
Get the position of the most recently added cursor in screen
coordinates.

TextEditor.name: getCursorScreenPositions
TextEditor.description: Get the position of all the cursor positions in screen coordinates.

TextEditor.name: getCursors
TextEditor.description: Get an Array of all {Cursor}s.

TextEditor.name: getCursorsOrderedByBufferPosition
TextEditor.description:
Get all {Cursors}s, ordered by their position in the buffer
instead of the order in which they were added.

TextEditor.name: getDecorations
TextEditor.description: Get all decorations.

TextEditor.name: getDefaultMarkerLayer
TextEditor.description: Get the default {DisplayMarkerLayer}.

TextEditor.name: getGrammar
TextEditor.description: Get the current {Grammar} of this editor.

TextEditor.name: getGutters
TextEditor.description: Get this editor's gutters.

TextEditor.name: getHighlightDecorations
TextEditor.description: Get all decorations of type 'highlight'.

TextEditor.name: getLastSelection
TextEditor.description: Get the most recently added {Selection}.

TextEditor.name: getLineDecorations
TextEditor.description: Get all decorations of type 'line'.

TextEditor.name: getLineNumberDecorations
TextEditor.description: Get all decorations of type 'line-number'.

TextEditor.name: getLongTitle
TextEditor.description:
Get unique title for display in other parts of the UI, such as
the window title.

TextEditor.name: getMarker
TextEditor.description:
Get the {DisplayMarker} on the default layer for the given
marker id.

TextEditor.name: getMarkerCount
TextEditor.description: Get the number of markers in the default marker layer.

TextEditor.name: getMarkerLayer
TextEditor.description: Get a {DisplayMarkerLayer} by id.

TextEditor.name: getMarkers
TextEditor.description:
Get all {DisplayMarker}s on the default marker layer. Consider
using {::findMarkers}

TextEditor.name: getOverlayDecorations
TextEditor.description: Get all decorations of type 'overlay'.

TextEditor.name: getPlaceholderText
TextEditor.description: Retrieves the greyed out placeholder of a mini editor.

TextEditor.name: getSelectedBufferRange
TextEditor.description:
Get the {Range} of the most recently added selection in buffer
coordinates.

TextEditor.name: getSelectedBufferRanges
TextEditor.description: Get the {Range}s of all selections in buffer coordinates.

TextEditor.name: getSelectedScreenRange
TextEditor.description:
Get the {Range} of the most recently added selection in screen
coordinates.

TextEditor.name: getSelectedScreenRanges
TextEditor.description: Get the {Range}s of all selections in screen coordinates.

TextEditor.name: getSelectedText
TextEditor.description: Get the selected text of the most recently added selection.

TextEditor.name: getSelections
TextEditor.description: Get current {Selection}s.

TextEditor.name: getSelectionsOrderedByBufferPosition
TextEditor.description:
Get all {Selection}s, ordered by their position in the buffer
instead of the order in which they were added.

TextEditor.name: getSoftWrapColumn
TextEditor.description: Gets the column at which column will soft wrap

TextEditor.name: getTabLength
TextEditor.description: Get the on-screen length of tab characters.

TextEditor.name: getTabText
TextEditor.description: Get the text representing a single level of indent.

TextEditor.name: getTextInBufferRange
TextEditor.description: Get the text in the given {Range} in buffer coordinates.

TextEditor.name: getTitle
TextEditor.description:
Get the editor's title for display in other parts of the
UI such as the tabs.

TextEditor.name: groupChangesSinceCheckpoint
TextEditor.description:
Group all changes since the given checkpoint into a single
transaction for purposes of undo/redo.

TextEditor.name: gutterWithName
TextEditor.description: Get the gutter with the given name.

TextEditor.name: indentLevelForLine
TextEditor.description: Get the indentation level of the given line of text.

TextEditor.name: indentSelectedRows
TextEditor.description: Indent rows intersecting selections by one level.

TextEditor.name: indentationForBufferRow
TextEditor.description: Get the indentation level of the given buffer row.

TextEditor.name: insertNewline
TextEditor.description: For each selection, replace the selected text with a newline.

TextEditor.name: insertNewlineAbove
TextEditor.description: For each cursor, insert a newline at the end of the preceding line.

TextEditor.name: insertNewlineBelow
TextEditor.description: For each cursor, insert a newline at beginning the following line.

TextEditor.name: insertText
TextEditor.description: For each selection, replace the selected text with the given text.

TextEditor.name: isBufferRowCommented
TextEditor.description: Determine if the given row is entirely a comment

TextEditor.name: isFoldableAtBufferRow
TextEditor.description: Determine whether the given row in buffer coordinates is foldable.

TextEditor.name: isFoldableAtScreenRow
TextEditor.description: Determine whether the given row in screen coordinates is foldable.

TextEditor.name: isFoldedAtBufferRow
TextEditor.description: Determine whether the given row in buffer coordinates is folded.

TextEditor.name: isFoldedAtCursorRow
TextEditor.description: Determine whether the most recently added cursor's row is folded.

TextEditor.name: isFoldedAtScreenRow
TextEditor.description: Determine whether the given row in screen coordinates is folded.

TextEditor.name: isSoftWrapped
TextEditor.description: Determine whether lines in this editor are soft-wrapped.

TextEditor.name: lowerCase
TextEditor.description: Convert the selected text to lower case.

TextEditor.name: markBufferPosition
TextEditor.description:
Create a marker on the default marker layer with the given buffer
position and no tail. To group multiple markers together in their own
private layer, see {::addMarkerLayer}.

TextEditor.name: markBufferRange
TextEditor.description:
Create a marker on the default marker layer with the given range
in buffer coordinates. This marker will maintain its logical location as the
buffer is changed, so if you mark a particular word, the marker will remain
over that word even if the word's location in the buffer changes.

TextEditor.name: markScreenPosition
TextEditor.description:
Create a marker on the default marker layer with the given screen
position and no tail. To group multiple markers together in their own
private layer, see {::addMarkerLayer}.

TextEditor.name: markScreenRange
TextEditor.description:
Create a marker on the default marker layer with the given range
in screen coordinates. This marker will maintain its logical location as the
buffer is changed, so if you mark a particular word, the marker will remain
over that word even if the word's location in the buffer changes.

TextEditor.name: moveDown
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor down one row in screen coordinates.

TextEditor.name: moveLeft
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor left one column.

TextEditor.name: moveRight
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor right one column.

TextEditor.name: moveToBeginningOfLine
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the beginning of its line in buffer coordinates.

TextEditor.name: moveToBeginningOfNextParagraph
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the beginning of the next paragraph.

TextEditor.name: moveToBeginningOfNextWord
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the beginning of the next word.

TextEditor.name: moveToBeginningOfPreviousParagraph
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the beginning of the previous paragraph.

TextEditor.name: moveToBeginningOfScreenLine
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the beginning of its line in screen coordinates.

TextEditor.name: moveToBeginningOfWord
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the beginning of its surrounding word.

TextEditor.name: moveToBottom
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the bottom of the buffer.

TextEditor.name: moveToEndOfLine
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the end of its line in buffer coordinates.

TextEditor.name: moveToEndOfScreenLine
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the end of its line in screen coordinates.

TextEditor.name: moveToEndOfWord
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the end of its surrounding word.

TextEditor.name: moveToFirstCharacterOfLine
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the first non-whitespace character of its line.

TextEditor.name: moveToNextSubwordBoundary
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the next subword boundary.

TextEditor.name: moveToNextWordBoundary
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the next word boundary.

TextEditor.name: moveToPreviousSubwordBoundary
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the previous subword boundary.

TextEditor.name: moveToPreviousWordBoundary
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the previous word boundary.

TextEditor.name: moveToTop
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor to the top of the buffer.

TextEditor.name: moveUp
TextEditor.description: Move every cursor up one row in screen coordinates.

TextEditor.name: mutateSelectedText
TextEditor.description: Mutate the text of all the selections in a single transaction.

TextEditor.name: observeCursors
TextEditor.description:
Calls your `callback` when a {Cursor} is added to the editor.
Immediately calls your callback for each existing cursor.

TextEditor.name: observeDecorations
TextEditor.description:
Calls your `callback` with each {Decoration} added to the editor.
Calls your `callback` immediately for any existing decorations.

TextEditor.name: observeGrammar
TextEditor.description:
Calls your `callback` when the grammar that interprets and
colorizes the text has been changed. Immediately calls your callback with
the current grammar.

TextEditor.name: observeGutters
TextEditor.description:
Calls your `callback` when a {Gutter} is added to the editor.
Immediately calls your callback for each existing gutter.

TextEditor.name: observeSelections
TextEditor.description:
Calls your `callback` when a {Selection} is added to the editor.
Immediately calls your callback for each existing selection.

TextEditor.name: onDidAddCursor
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when a {Cursor} is added to the editor.

TextEditor.name: onDidAddDecoration
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when a {Decoration} is added to the editor.

TextEditor.name: onDidAddGutter
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when a {Gutter} is added to the editor.

TextEditor.name: onDidAddSelection
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when a {Selection} is added to the editor.

TextEditor.name: onDidChange
TextEditor.description:
Invoke the given callback synchronously when the content of the
buffer changes.

TextEditor.name: onDidChangeCursorPosition
TextEditor.description:
Calls your `callback` when a {Cursor} is moved. If there are
multiple cursors, your callback will be called for each cursor.

TextEditor.name: onDidChangeEncoding
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when the buffer's encoding has changed.

TextEditor.name: onDidChangeGrammar
TextEditor.description:
Calls your `callback` when the grammar that interprets and
colorizes the text has been changed.

TextEditor.name: onDidChangeModified
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when the result of {::isModified} changes.

TextEditor.name: onDidChangePath
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when the buffer's path, and therefore title, has changed.

TextEditor.name: onDidChangePlaceholderText
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when the placeholder text is changed.

TextEditor.name: onDidChangeSelectionRange
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when a selection's screen range changes.

TextEditor.name: onDidChangeSoftWrapped
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when soft wrap was enabled or disabled.

TextEditor.name: onDidChangeTitle
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when the buffer's title has changed.

TextEditor.name: onDidConflict
TextEditor.description:
Calls your `callback` when the buffer's underlying file changes on
disk at a moment when the result of {::isModified} is true.

TextEditor.name: onDidDestroy
TextEditor.description: Invoke the given callback when the editor is destroyed.

TextEditor.name: onDidInsertText
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` after text has been inserted.

TextEditor.name: onDidRemoveCursor
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when a {Cursor} is removed from the editor.

TextEditor.name: onDidRemoveDecoration
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when a {Decoration} is removed from the editor.

TextEditor.name: onDidRemoveGutter
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when a {Gutter} is removed from the editor.

TextEditor.name: onDidRemoveSelection
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` when a {Selection} is removed from the editor.

TextEditor.name: onDidSave
TextEditor.description: Invoke the given callback after the buffer is saved to disk.

TextEditor.name: onDidStopChanging
TextEditor.description:
Invoke `callback` when the buffer's contents change. It is
emit asynchronously 300ms after the last buffer change. This is a good place
to handle changes to the buffer without compromising typing performance.

TextEditor.name: onWillInsertText
TextEditor.description: Calls your `callback` before text has been inserted.

TextEditor.name: outdentSelectedRows
TextEditor.description: Outdent rows intersecting selections by one level.

TextEditor.name: pasteText
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, replace the selected text with the contents of
the clipboard.

TextEditor.name: redo
TextEditor.description: Redo the last change.

TextEditor.name: revertToCheckpoint
TextEditor.description:
Revert the buffer to the state it was in when the given
checkpoint was created.

TextEditor.name: save
TextEditor.description: Saves the editor's text buffer.

TextEditor.name: saveAs
TextEditor.description: Saves the editor's text buffer as the given path.

TextEditor.name: scan
TextEditor.description:
Scan regular expression matches in the entire buffer, calling the
given iterator function on each match.

TextEditor.name: scanInBufferRange
TextEditor.description:
Scan regular expression matches in a given range, calling the given
iterator function on each match.

TextEditor.name: scopeDescriptorForBufferPosition
TextEditor.description:
Get the syntactic scopeDescriptor for the given position in buffer
coordinates. Useful with {Config::get}.

TextEditor.name: screenPositionForBufferPosition
TextEditor.description: Convert a position in buffer-coordinates to screen-coordinates.

TextEditor.name: screenRangeForBufferRange
TextEditor.description: Convert a range in buffer-coordinates to screen-coordinates.

TextEditor.name: scrollToBufferPosition
TextEditor.description: Scrolls the editor to the given buffer position.

TextEditor.name: scrollToCursorPosition
TextEditor.description:
Scroll the editor to reveal the most recently added cursor if it is
off-screen.

TextEditor.name: scrollToScreenPosition
TextEditor.description: Scrolls the editor to the given screen position.

TextEditor.name: selectAll
TextEditor.description: Select all text in the buffer.

TextEditor.name: selectDown
TextEditor.description:
Move the cursor of each selection one character downward while
preserving the selection's tail position.

TextEditor.name: selectLeft
TextEditor.description:
Move the cursor of each selection one character leftward while
preserving the selection's tail position.

TextEditor.name: selectLinesContainingCursors
TextEditor.description: For each cursor, select the containing line.

TextEditor.name: selectMarker
TextEditor.description: Select the range of the given marker if it is valid.

TextEditor.name: selectRight
TextEditor.description:
Move the cursor of each selection one character rightward while
preserving the selection's tail position.

TextEditor.name: selectToBeginningOfLine
TextEditor.description:
Move the cursor of each selection to the beginning of its line
while preserving the selection's tail position.

TextEditor.name: selectToBeginningOfNextParagraph
TextEditor.description: Expand selections to the beginning of the next paragraph.

TextEditor.name: selectToBeginningOfNextWord
TextEditor.description: Expand selections to the beginning of the next word.

TextEditor.name: selectToBeginningOfPreviousParagraph
TextEditor.description: Expand selections to the beginning of the next paragraph.

TextEditor.name: selectToBeginningOfWord
TextEditor.description: Expand selections to the beginning of their containing word.

TextEditor.name: selectToBottom
TextEditor.description:
Selects from the top of the first selection in the buffer to the end
of the buffer.

TextEditor.name: selectToBufferPosition
TextEditor.description:
Select from the current cursor position to the given position in
buffer coordinates.

TextEditor.name: selectToEndOfLine
TextEditor.description:
Move the cursor of each selection to the end of its line while
preserving the selection's tail position.

TextEditor.name: selectToEndOfWord
TextEditor.description: Expand selections to the end of their containing word.

TextEditor.name: selectToFirstCharacterOfLine
TextEditor.description:
Move the cursor of each selection to the first non-whitespace
character of its line while preserving the selection's tail position. If the
cursor is already on the first character of the line, move it to the
beginning of the line.

TextEditor.name: selectToNextSubwordBoundary
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, move its cursor to the next subword boundary
while maintaining the selection's tail position.

TextEditor.name: selectToNextWordBoundary
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, move its cursor to the next word boundary while
maintaining the selection's tail position.

TextEditor.name: selectToPreviousSubwordBoundary
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, move its cursor to the preceding subword
boundary while maintaining the selection's tail position.

TextEditor.name: selectToPreviousWordBoundary
TextEditor.description:
For each selection, move its cursor to the preceding word boundary
while maintaining the selection's tail position.

TextEditor.name: selectToScreenPosition
TextEditor.description:
Select from the current cursor position to the given position in
screen coordinates.

TextEditor.name: selectToTop
TextEditor.description:
Select from the top of the buffer to the end of the last selection
in the buffer.

TextEditor.name: selectUp
TextEditor.description:
Move the cursor of each selection one character upward while
preserving the selection's tail position.

TextEditor.name: selectWordsContainingCursors
TextEditor.description: Select the word surrounding each cursor.

TextEditor.name: selectionIntersectsBufferRange
TextEditor.description:
Determine if a given range in buffer coordinates intersects a
selection.

TextEditor.name: setCursorBufferPosition
TextEditor.description: Move the cursor to the given position in buffer coordinates.

TextEditor.name: setCursorScreenPosition
TextEditor.description: Move the cursor to the given position in screen coordinates.

TextEditor.name: setEncoding
TextEditor.description:
Set the character set encoding to use in this editor's text
buffer.

TextEditor.name: setGrammar
TextEditor.description: Set the current {Grammar} of this editor.

TextEditor.name: setIndentationForBufferRow
TextEditor.description: Set the indentation level for the given buffer row.

TextEditor.name: setPlaceholderText
TextEditor.description:
Set the greyed out placeholder of a mini editor. Placeholder text
will be displayed when the editor has no content.

TextEditor.name: setSelectedBufferRange
TextEditor.description:
Set the selected range in buffer coordinates. If there are multiple
selections, they are reduced to a single selection with the given range.

TextEditor.name: setSelectedBufferRanges
TextEditor.description:
Set the selected ranges in buffer coordinates. If there are multiple
selections, they are replaced by new selections with the given ranges.

TextEditor.name: setSelectedScreenRange
TextEditor.description:
Set the selected range in screen coordinates. If there are multiple
selections, they are reduced to a single selection with the given range.

TextEditor.name: setSelectedScreenRanges
TextEditor.description:
Set the selected ranges in screen coordinates. If there are multiple
selections, they are replaced by new selections with the given ranges.

TextEditor.name: setSoftTabs
TextEditor.description: Enable or disable soft tabs for this editor.

TextEditor.name: setSoftWrapped
TextEditor.description: Enable or disable soft wrapping for this editor.

TextEditor.name: setTabLength
TextEditor.description:
Set the on-screen length of tab characters. Setting this to a
{Number} This will override the `editor.tabLength` setting.

TextEditor.name: setText
TextEditor.description: Replaces the entire contents of the buffer with the given {String}.

TextEditor.name: setTextInBufferRange
TextEditor.description: Set the text in the given {Range} in buffer coordinates.

TextEditor.name: toggleFoldAtBufferRow
TextEditor.description:
Fold the given buffer row if it isn't currently folded, and unfold
it otherwise.

TextEditor.name: toggleLineCommentsInSelection
TextEditor.description: Toggle line comments for rows intersecting selections.

TextEditor.name: toggleSoftTabs
TextEditor.description: Toggle soft tabs for this editor

TextEditor.name: toggleSoftWrapped
TextEditor.description: Toggle soft wrapping for this editor

TextEditor.name: transact
TextEditor.description: Batch multiple operations as a single undo/redo step.

TextEditor.name: transpose
TextEditor.description: For each selection, transpose the selected text.

TextEditor.name: undo
TextEditor.description: Undo the last change.

TextEditor.name: unfoldAll
TextEditor.description: Unfold all existing folds.

TextEditor.name: unfoldBufferRow
TextEditor.description: Unfold all folds containing the given row in buffer coordinates.

TextEditor.name: unfoldCurrentRow
TextEditor.description: Unfold the most recent cursor's row by one level.

TextEditor.name: upperCase
TextEditor.description: Convert the selected text to upper case.

TextEditor.name: usesSoftTabs
TextEditor.description: Determine if the buffer uses hard or soft tabs.

ThemeManager.name: getEnabledThemeNames
ThemeManager.description: Get the enabled theme names from the config.

ThemeManager.name: onDidChangeActiveThemes
ThemeManager.description:
Invoke `callback` when style sheet changes associated with
updating the list of active themes have completed.

TooltipManager.name: add
TooltipManager.description: Add a tooltip to the given element.

TooltipManager.name: findTooltips
TooltipManager.description: Find the tooltips that have been applied to the given element.

ViewRegistry.name: addViewProvider
ViewRegistry.description:
Add a provider that will be used to construct views in the
workspace's view layer based on model objects in its model layer.

ViewRegistry.name: getView
ViewRegistry.description: Get the view associated with an object in the workspace.

Workspace.name: activateNextPane
Workspace.description: Make the next pane active.

Workspace.name: activatePreviousPane
Workspace.description: Make the previous pane active.

Workspace.name: addBottomPanel
Workspace.description: Adds a panel item to the bottom of the editor window.

Workspace.name: addFooterPanel
Workspace.description: Adds a panel item to the footer.

Workspace.name: addHeaderPanel
Workspace.description: Adds a panel item to the header.

Workspace.name: addLeftPanel
Workspace.description: Adds a panel item to the left of the editor window.

Workspace.name: addModalPanel
Workspace.description: Adds a panel item as a modal dialog.

Workspace.name: addOpener
Workspace.description: Register an opener for a uri.

Workspace.name: addRightPanel
Workspace.description: Adds a panel item to the right of the editor window.

Workspace.name: addTopPanel
Workspace.description: Adds a panel item to the top of the editor window above the tabs.

Workspace.name: buildTextEditor
Workspace.description: Create a new text editor.

Workspace.name: createItemForURI
Workspace.description: Creates a new item that corresponds to the provided URI.

Workspace.name: getActivePane
Workspace.description: Get the active {Pane}.

Workspace.name: getActivePaneContainer
Workspace.description: Get the most recently focused pane container.

Workspace.name: getActivePaneItem
Workspace.description: Get the active {Pane}'s active item.

Workspace.name: getActiveTextEditor
Workspace.description: Get the workspace center's active item if it is a {TextEditor}.

Workspace.name: getBottomDock
Workspace.description: Get the {Dock} below the editor window.

Workspace.name: getBottomPanels
Workspace.description: Get an {Array} of all the panel items at the bottom of the editor window.

Workspace.name: getCenter
Workspace.description: Get the {WorkspaceCenter} at the center of the editor window.

Workspace.name: getFooterPanels
Workspace.description: Get an {Array} of all the panel items in the footer.

Workspace.name: getHeaderPanels
Workspace.description: Get an {Array} of all the panel items in the header.

Workspace.name: getLeftDock
Workspace.description: Get the {Dock} to the left of the editor window.

Workspace.name: getLeftPanels
Workspace.description: Get an {Array} of all the panel items to the left of the editor window.

Workspace.name: getModalPanels
Workspace.description: Get an {Array} of all the modal panel items

Workspace.name: getPaneItems
Workspace.description: Get all pane items in the workspace.

Workspace.name: getPanes
Workspace.description: Get all panes in the workspace.

Workspace.name: getRightDock
Workspace.description: Get the {Dock} to the right of the editor window.

Workspace.name: getRightPanels
Workspace.description: Get an {Array} of all the panel items to the right of the editor window.

Workspace.name: getTextEditors
Workspace.description: Get all text editors in the workspace.

Workspace.name: getTopPanels
Workspace.description: Get an {Array} of all the panel items at the top of the editor window.

Workspace.name: hide
Workspace.description: Search the workspace for items matching the given URI and hide them.

Workspace.name: observeActivePane
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback with the current active pane and when
the active pane changes.

Workspace.name: observeActivePaneItem
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback with the current active pane item and
with all future active pane items in the workspace.

Workspace.name: observeActiveTextEditor
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback with the current active text editor
(if any), with all future active text editors, and when there is no longer
an active text editor.

Workspace.name: observePaneItems
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback with all current and future panes items
in the workspace.

Workspace.name: observePanes
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback with all current and future panes in the
workspace.

Workspace.name: observeTextEditors
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback with all current and future text
editors in the workspace.

Workspace.name: onDidAddPane
Workspace.description: Invoke the given callback when a pane is added to the workspace.

Workspace.name: onDidAddPaneItem
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback when a pane item is added to the
workspace.

Workspace.name: onDidAddTextEditor
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback when a text editor is added to the
workspace.

Workspace.name: onDidChangeActivePane
Workspace.description: Invoke the given callback when the active pane changes.

Workspace.name: onDidChangeActivePaneItem
Workspace.description: Invoke the given callback when the active pane item changes.

Workspace.name: onDidChangeActiveTextEditor
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback when a text editor becomes the active
text editor and when there is no longer an active text editor.

Workspace.name: onDidDestroyPane
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback when a pane is destroyed in the
workspace.

Workspace.name: onDidDestroyPaneItem
Workspace.description: Invoke the given callback when a pane item is destroyed.

Workspace.name: onDidOpen
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback whenever an item is opened. Unlike
{::onDidAddPaneItem}, observers will be notified for items that are already
present in the workspace when they are reopened.

Workspace.name: onDidStopChangingActivePaneItem
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback when the active pane item stops
changing.

Workspace.name: onWillDestroyPane
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback before a pane is destroyed in the
workspace.

Workspace.name: onWillDestroyPaneItem
Workspace.description:
Invoke the given callback when a pane item is about to be
destroyed, before the user is prompted to save it.

Workspace.name: open
Workspace.description:
Opens the given URI in Atom asynchronously.
If the URI is already open, the existing item for that URI will be
activated. If no URI is given, or no registered opener can open
the URI, a new empty {TextEditor} will be created.

Workspace.name: paneContainerForItem
Workspace.description: Get the first pane container that contains the given item.

Workspace.name: paneContainerForURI
Workspace.description:
Get the first pane container that contains an item with the given
URI.

Workspace.name: paneForItem
Workspace.description: Get the {Pane} containing the given item.

Workspace.name: paneForURI
Workspace.description: Get the first {Pane} that contains an item with the given URI.

Workspace.name: reopenItem
Workspace.description:
Asynchronously reopens the last-closed item's URI if it hasn't already been
reopened.

Workspace.name: replace
Workspace.description: Performs a replace across all the specified files in the project.

Workspace.name: scan
Workspace.description: Performs a search across all files in the workspace.

Workspace.name: toggle
Workspace.description:
Search the workspace for items matching the given URI. If any are found, hide them.
Otherwise, open the URL.
